title: American_Top_40_1975_July_12th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

There is a debut song by a threesome in this countdown that has hit number one three times and each hit stayed at number one for at least three weeks (and one was titled "Knock Three Times").

Casey answers the question, "Has there ever been a weekly survey where all ten of the top ten positions were occupied by British artists?"

Casey tells of one artist in the countdown who one summer hosted a television show, and the premise of the show was that no one had ever heard of him!

Casey answers the question, "What single in the rock era has sold the most copies?"

The Captain And Tennille are in the number one position. This week they accomplish something that hasn't been done in the previous two years. Casey gives the details.

One artist in the countdown swallowed a humming-bird as a child.

Sorry for the few seconds missing from numbers 14, 20, and 33. I usually record three broadcasts of the same show so I don't miss anything, but this time I only got one.

40: Sweet Emotion - Aerosmith
39: Just A Little Bit Of You - Michael Jackson
